intro: Hieracium deargicola, commonly known as the Dargie's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny exposure. It produces yellow to orange ray florets surrounded by a dense cluster of tubular disc florets. Hieracium deargicola is often found in meadows and rocky slopes at high altitudes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
